stimulusHtml: In the absence of barriers to entry, a typical firm is currently in long-run equilibrium. Assume there is an increase in the market demand for the good that the firm is producing. Which of the following will happen in the long run?
choicesHtml: New firms will enter the market.
The market supply will decrease, but the quantity supplied will increase.
The firm will earn positive economic profit.
The firmâ€™s price will be greater than its average revenue.
The firm will continue to produce the same quantity of output.
